[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Package Visibility Bypass] The actuate() function calls on_demand::set_guardian_queue_id, which has 'public(package)' visibility. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [Cross-Module State Consistency] The run() function modifies State but doesn't check if the new guardian_queue_id is compatible with other State fields (oracle_queue, on_demand_package_id). [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Module: set_guardian_queue_id_action] [Missing Dependency Checks] The module imports on_demand but doesn't verify version compatibility or module address consistency. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Guardian Queue Capabilities] The actuate() function doesn't verify that the new guardian queue has the necessary capabilities or permissions to actually validate oracle updates. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [No Active Operations Check] The run() function doesn't check if there are active oracle operations or pending guardian validations. Can changing the guardian queue mid-operation cause in-flight oracle updates to be validated against the wrong guardian queue, leading to price data inconsistencies? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [No Migration Path] The run() function provides no migration or transition logic when changing guardian queues. If Queue A is replaced with Queue B, how are pending validations from Queue A handled, and can this create a gap where oracle updates are neither validated by the old nor the new guardian queue? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [No Deprecation Flag] The actuate() function doesn't mark the old guardian queue as deprecated or notify it of being replaced. Can the old guardian queue continue accepting and processing validation requests after being replaced, leading to conflicting validation states? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [No Oracle Queue Impact Analysis] The run() function doesn't check how many oracle queues depend on the current guardian queue. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [No Emergency Mode] The run() function has no emergency or maintenance mode flag. In a security incident where the guardian queue is compromised, can the admin quickly set a backup guardian queue, or could there be delays/failures in emergency guardian queue rotation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [Single Point of Failure] The run() function allows a single AdminCap holder to change the guardian queue without any backup or redundancy mechanisms. If the admin key is lost or the admin is unavailable during a security incident, can the guardian queue be changed at all, creating a single point of failure? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [No Previous Values History] The actuate() function only emits the immediate previous guardian_queue_id in the event, with no history tracking. [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [No Gas Optimization] The run() function doesn't check if the new guardian_queue_id is the same as the current one before calling actuate(). [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_guardian_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Redundant State Read] The actuate() function calls state.guardian_queue() to get the old value right before changing it.
